subject: RE: [junit] Testing getXXX( ) and setXXX( ) methods
msgSnippet: ... I hope this was tongue-in-cheek. I don t think I have *ever* returned the wrong variable from a getX() method[1]. In order to make this mistake, I d have
messageBody:
Quoting "Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-MBC)" <timothy.j.stevens@...>:

>
> Can't break!!?? You never make typos and return the wrong variable
> in a getter, or set the wrong variable in a setter? If so, you're a
> better
> coder than me :)

I hope this was tongue-in-cheek. I don't think I have *ever* returned the wrong
variable from a getX() method[1]. In order to make this mistake, I'd have to be
drunk. As for setting the wrong variable in a setX() method, see my previous
message. I've made that mistake exactly once.

Folks, don't test the getX() and setX() methods; but rather test that the
constructor stores the appropriate parameter in the appropriate field. I know
I'm about 100 times more likely to write a bug there than in the getX() or setX
() method itself.

J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Let's write software that people understand.

[1] Note that I'm ignoring cases where the compiler caught a typo.
